meanings.definition: to make irregular, rapid movements or contractions
meanings.sent1: The tiny fish in the pond were fibrillating in excitement.
meanings.sent2: The heart was fibrillating uncontrollably during the stressful situation.
meanings.sent3: The robot started fibrillating on the dance floor, much to the amusement of the audience.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the tree were fibrillating in the wind, creating a mesmerizing dance.
meanings.sent5: The nerves were fibrillating with anticipation before the big announcement.

meanings.sent1: The fibrillating heart needed immediate medical attention.
meanings.sent2: The fibrillating machine was causing disruptions in the production line.
meanings.sent3: The fibrillating light bulb flickered on and off, creating a disco effect in the room.
meanings.sent4: The fibrillating engine made strange noises, indicating a problem.
meanings.sent5: The fibrillating wire sparked and sputtered, showing signs of wear and tear.

meanings.definition: the act or process of fibrillating
meanings.sent1: The fibrillating of the muscles was a sign of fatigue.
meanings.sent2: The doctor observed the fibrillating of the patient's heart on the monitor.
meanings.sent3: The fibrillating of the old clock made it sound like a drumbeat.
meanings.sent4: The fibrillating of the wings helped the bird stay aloft in the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The fibrillating of the electrical wires caused a power outage in the neighborhood.
